fgeo.abundance 0.0.0.9004
  • Reference
  • fgeo

Collapse treeid, picking only the one stem (per censusid) per treeid.

Source: R/collapse_treeid.R
collapse_treeid.Rd

collapse_treeid_max() and collapse_treeid_min() pick the stem with the maximum and minimum dbh per treeid per censusid.

collapse_treeid_min(.x)

collapse_treeid_max(.x)

Arguments

.x

A dataframe; particularly a ForestGEO census or ViewFullTable.

Value

A dataframe with one row per per treeid per censusid.

Examples

library(tidyverse)
#> -- Attaching packages ------------------------------------------------ tidyverse 1.2.1 --
#> v ggplot2 3.0.0     v readr   1.1.1
#> v tibble  1.4.2     v purrr   0.2.5
#> v tidyr   0.8.1     v stringr 1.3.1
#> v ggplot2 3.0.0     v forcats 0.3.0
#> -- Conflicts --------------------------------------------------- tidyverse_conflicts() --
#> x fgeo.tool::filter() masks dplyr::filter(), stats::filter()
#> x dplyr::lag()        masks stats::lag()

census <- tibble::tribble(
  ~dbh,   ~sp, ~treeID, ~stemID,
    10, "sp1",     "1",   "1.1",
   100, "sp1",     "1",   "1.2",
    22, "sp2",     "2",   "2.1",
    99, "sp2",     "2",   "2.2",
    99, "sp2",     "2",   "2.3",
    NA, "sp2",     "2",   "2.4"
)

collapse_treeid_max(census)
#> # A tibble: 2 x 4
#>     dbh sp    treeID stemID
#>   <dbl> <chr> <chr>  <chr> 
#> 1   100 sp1   1      1.2   
#> 2    99 sp2   2      2.2   
collapse_treeid_min(census)
#> # A tibble: 2 x 4
#>     dbh sp    treeID stemID
#>   <dbl> <chr> <chr>  <chr> 
#> 1    10 sp1   1      1.1   
#> 2    22 sp2   2      2.1
